name: Jlmdevelopertools
body:
Welcome to Developer tools
Home
Skills
Portfolio
About
Contact
My Blog
I am an independent web developer passionate about learning and the possibilities today’s web has to offer.
Check out some things I’ve built
Skills

 I create websites using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Using WordPress as the main CMS enables my clients to take charge of content management once their project is complete – if they so wish. I additionally focus on responsive design to ensure my client’s sites work well on any screen size and device.
I also offer copywriting, proofreading and editing as well as content management services.

My role in the creation of your web presence can be anything from a one-time meeting to an ongoing experience with continuous support.

My key skills:

HTML
CSS 3
JavaScript & jQuery
WordPress
Responsive Design
Copywriting, editing and proof-reading
Portfolio

Screen Shot 2015-03-22 at 8.04.21 PM
First Personal Website

 My first personal website using HTML and CSS.

Screen Shot 2014-06-10 at 5.18.52 PM
Replication of existing website

A replication of the existing website heatherpayne.ca with added responsive design ideas (final version in progress). This website is mobile.

See it live

FeedMeScreenShot
Feed Me Web Application

A web app that helps find recipes using the yummly API to display recipes based on up to three dietary restrictions and one ingredient the user wants to include. This app works on both desktop and mobile.

See it live

Wireframe
From Wireframe to Website

Unless a design is provided, I develop wireframes and a Style Guide together with the client before starting to code the their project. That way, we can ensure we are on the same page before starting the main work.

Screen Shot 2015-03-22 at 7.51.52 PM
Cheveux Toronto

Customizing a theme, this boutique salon received a much-needed, professional online presence within a matter of days.

See it live

Screen Shot 2015-03-22 at 8.40.04 PM
XN Logic Graph Databases

Online presence of XN Logic using an existing theme and customizing it according to the company’s needs.

See it live

About

I am a linguist turned front-end web developer.
I have been fascinated by language for as long as I can remember. After completing my graduate studies in linguistics and communications, I worked as a remedial language therapist, and communications instructor.
When I started playing around with code at one of my favourite organizations, Ladies Learning Code, I immediately fell in love with its possibilities. Now I get to combine two of my favourite things: arts & crafts and language.
I am eager to learn new things every day and taking on challenging projects excites and motivates me.
I work remotely, but am currently located in Toronto, Ontario.
If you have a project you would like to chat about, please contact me below or send me an email to hello@annacolebatch.com

Virtual Host:

mydrupalsite.dev
mydrupalsite_db

On Windows changes for creating virtual host:

1. Navigate to C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc
2. Change file type to all files.
3. Open hosts file.
4. Add this at the end of the line:

127.0.0.1 mydrupalsite.dev

5. Save file.
6. Start Apache.
7. Enter virtual host name to web browser address bar

Continous Deployment:

Maturity Model Phase 1(3-6 months)

1. Trusted Source Control and Issue tracking
2. TDD
3. Continous integration
4. Automation of deployments
5. And you are still nowhere near continous deployment

Phase 1 Activities:

Write test first
Write deployment scripts first
Pair program on the challenging parts
Increase the frequency of everything which means automate everything

TDD in 1 Week Outline:
1. Refuse to write console.log statements or use the debugger(because of typo problem such as semi-colon or type checking problem)
2. If you are using Javascript,you are screwed if you dont write tests.

Automation in 1 Week
1. Dont type anything in a remote shell.Do eveything via Fabric,Capistrano,etc
2. Put your automation code in git submodule so you can reuse across your projects
3. When stable(after a few projects) turn it into a node module with reference in package.json


Maturity Model Phase 2(6-9 months):

What are the chances of getting a small feature deployed into production safely in 1 hr

1. Feature based thinking
A. small,logical commits with good commit messages
B. good tests(and an architect that supports them)
C. Continous integration metrics are trending excellent

Comfortable feature flow
1. WIP is managed via real Scrum/Kanban
2. all features reviewed or pair-programmed(strongly related to pull request)
3. deployment to staging is semi-automated
4. Focus on clarity,sustainability,and velocity - i.e flow,not capacity

Phase 2 Activities:

1. Lots of Git hooks
2. JSHint
3. Reject any commit that doesn't pass lint and that doesn't have a headline
4. Single commit per pull request(git inteactive rebasing)
5. Everyone is a Git ninja and the commits are clear,concise and independent

Phase 3(9-12 months):

Are you ready for multiple deploys per day?
1. First commit acceptance rate
2. % Issues captured on staging versus production
3. Are you discussing getting rid of the staging server
4. How fast are your deploys?Rollbacks?

Phase 3 Activities:

1. Review performance metrics
2. Clear define the cost-benefit of production failures
3. Increase frequencies of deployments in the concept of your production failure risk profile

Tools:

1. GIT
2. Jenkins
3. Mocha
4. Karma
5. Kanban/Scrum(Trello)
6. Commitment

GIT for Continous Deployment

1. git rebase master every day
2. git rebase interactive
A. Before pull request
B. every few days on more complex features


Mastering Commits rebase
1. If rebasing branches already push remotely
A. ensure only admin can rewrite master
B. Configure all local environments to only push current branch

gitconfig
[push]
default = upstream
GIT Sub Modules

I knew going into Bloc that my biggest area of improvement was my ability to code in Ruby - I was familiar enough with the Rails framework but creating custom Ruby code was still challenging. So I practiced Ruby every day.

Research what is Fabric
Break down the problem into the simplest possible parts. Try to do them one at a time, such as in a console, so you can clearly understand what is and isn’t working.
Duplicating of a whole line : CTRL+D . Setting the cursor at the end of any line and pressing this combination ,  duplicates the current line (the new line is positioned under the current line)
Regex pattern for form validation
1. websignup_review_form_validate($form, &$form_state)
2. ava_websignup_form_alter($form, &$form_state,$form_id)
3. ava_websignup_webform_submission_insert($node,$submission)

ava_websignup.module functions:

1. ava_websignup_webform_submission_insert($node,$submission)
2. ava_websignup_form_alter(&$form, &$form_state, $form_id)
3. websignup_review_form_validate(&$form, &$form_state)
